description: Left-right/right-left numbers: n = pq such that n=q_reversed*p_reversed.
comments: A subset of A179482; only two factors permitted [From Adam Kertesz (Kertesz.Adam(AT)gmail.com), Aug 07 2010]The sequence is infinite, since it contains at least 3 infinite subsequences, namely b(n) = 3*(88810 + 2099*10^(6*n))/33670 = 187029, 187021087029,... c(n) = 11011*(1 + 100^(1 + 2*n))/101 = 109019911, 1090198019911,... and d(n) = 3*(53*10000^n - 14900)/10100 = 153, 1574253,... - _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 17 2013
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..30
author: Mario Velucchi (mathchess(AT)velucchi.it)
extensions: _David W. Wilson_ has verified that all terms shown are correct - Thu Sep 28 16:28:03 2000
